content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    regex = r"```julia\n((?:[^`]*|`[^`]*`)*)\n```"m
    matchdata = match(regex, md)
    
    if isnothing(matchdata) || length(matchdata.captures) == 0
        return ""
    end
    
    code_str = matchdata.captures[1]
    # Remove code fences and join code blocks
    return replace(code_str, r"\n```julia\n" => "\n", r"\n```" => "")
end
```

This function defines a regular expression pattern to match Julia code blocks in markdown. It then searches the markdown input `md` for matches.

If no matches are found or there are no captured code blocks, it returns an empty string.

Otherwise, it processes the matched code block(s) by removing the code fences and joining any multiple code blocks together with a newline character (`\n`). The resulting String is then returned.
